intro: Lappula sharsmithii, commonly known as Sharsmith's lappula, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent, ribbed leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
